name: fileSetAccessMode
description: Sets the attributes of an on-disk file on UNIX or Linux. This function does not work with in-memory files.

params.name: mode
params.description:
Access mode (the same attributes you use for the Linux command 'chmod')

Each digit specifies who is granted the access:
* 1st digit: owner
* 2nd digit: group
* 3rd digit: other

Each number specifies which right is granted:
* 4: read (r)
* 2: write (w)
* 1: execute (e)

Let's assume that matrix as seen on linux systems: rwerwerwe. You can combine the numbers for read, write and execute permissions to achieve combined permissions:
* 3: write & execute
* 5: read & execute
* 6: read & write
* 7: read, write and execute

For example, 400 specifies that only the owner can read the file; 004 specifies that anyone can read the file.
In rwe-notation 400 means r-------- and 004 ------r-- whereas 751 means rwer-er--.
